page.title: 14FARMING
page.content: The main type of farming is dairying. The climate and type of soil is an advantage and the large markets adjacent to Renfrew (eg Glasgow) provides a ready market for milk. The average size of farm is around 100 hectares. Rape is grown on most farms as a fodder crop for winter feed and as a cash crop for the extraction of vegetable oils. Drainage is a problem on most farms. Field drains using tiles are used. The main breed of dairy cow is Ayrshire with some Friesians. Recent EEC decisions to cut back milk production by 45% has caused a number of problems. A characteristic building on all farms is the silo where the winter feed is stored. A problem facing farmers is the disposal of silage effluent. If it escapes onto the land it can cause serious pollution.
